summary: This document is an email chain between defense attorneys Bruce Barket and Aida Leisenring and a prosecutor regarding discovery requests related to the July 23, 2019 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody. The defense seeks access to video surveillance, photos of the cell, and the physical 'orange rope' for the penalty phase of their case.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney from Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, sending an email requesting to examine physical evidence (the 'rope') from the July 23 incident for the penalty phase.

persons.name: Aida Leisenring
persons.context: Attorney from Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP, who wrote the initial email memorializing follow-up discovery requests for video, photos, and the orange rope related to the July 23 incident.

persons.name: Jason
persons.context: Co-Chief of the Narcotics Unit, responding to the defense's discovery requests, stating they are looking into the availability of video/photos and the preservation of the orange rope.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at the same law firm (Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP) and are corresponding on the same case regarding discovery.
Defense attorney (Leisenring) is making discovery requests to a prosecutor (Jason) regarding evidence from the July 23 incident.
Defense attorney (Barket) is corresponding with a prosecutor (Jason) regarding the examination of evidence (the rope) from the July 23 incident.

events.title: July 23 Incident (Epstein's Death)
events.description: The incident referenced is the death of Jeffrey Epstein in his jail cell (cell 124) on July 23, 2019. The correspondence discusses evidence related to this event, including video, photos, and an 'orange rope'.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: The defense team for Jeffrey Epstein was actively seeking discovery related to his death on July 23, 2019, as part of the 'penalty phase' of their case.
Specific evidence requested includes: video surveillance of the hallway near the tier, photographs or video of cell 124 taken shortly after the incident, and the physical 'orange rope'.
The prosecutor's office (Narcotics Unit) was evaluating whether the orange rope was preserved and would consider the defense's request for inspection, asking them to articulate a basis for it.
The correspondence confirms the existence of a photograph of the 'orange rope' that the defense had already reviewed.
